etymology.description: 預(預) (yù, "in advance") + 定(定) (dìng, "decide; settle") = to arrange or schedule something in advance
etymology.interpretation: The word 預定(預定) (yùdìng, "schedule; book") is composed of 預(預) (yù, "in advance") and 定(定) (dìng, "decide; settle"). Together, these morphemes convey the action of arranging or deciding something before it happens, which can apply to making reservations, scheduling events, or booking in general.
etymology.simplification: Simplified characters match the traditional ones provided.

examples.chinese: 我预定了一张电影票(我預定了一張電影票)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ yùdìngle yī zhāng diànyǐng piào.

examples.chinese: 他预定了会议室(他預定了會議室)，打算安排讨论(打算安排討論)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yùdìngle huìyì shì, dǎsuàn ānpái tǎolùn.
examples.english: He booked the conference room and plans to organize a discussion.
